official-title.#text:
To prohibit the use of drones to kill citizens of the
		  United States within the United States.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committees on the

, for a
			 period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for
			 consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the
			 committee concerned

term.#tail: means an unmanned aircraft (as defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 331 of the
			 FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012/s:331

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section
			 1365 of title 18, United States Code

term.#tail: has the meaning given that term in

as used in a territorial sense, has the meaning
			 given that term in

text.#text:
The
			 Federal Government may not use a drone to kill a citizen of the United States
			 who is located in the United States. The prohibition under this subsection
			 shall not apply to an individual who poses an imminent threat of death or
			 serious bodily injury to another individual. Nothing in this section shall be
			 construed to suggest that the Constitution would otherwise allow the killing of
			 a citizen of the United States in the United States without due process of
			 law.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 1242 IH: To prohibit the use of drones to kill citizens of the United States within the United States.
